intro: Agalinis delicatula, commonly known as the slender bluemink, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, grass-like leaves and small, pale blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as sandy soils and disturbed areas. It is an annual or biennial herb that produces numerous small seeds, which are dispersed by wind. Due to habitat loss and competition from invasive species, it is considered threatened in some regions.
